alert.note: Alert for Northern St. Tammany; Southeast St. Tammany (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 16 at 2:38AM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Orleans, southeastern St. Tammany Parishes in southeastern Louisiana and southwestern Hancock Counties through 315 AM CDT... At 238 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Lake Catherine, or 9 miles east of New Orleans, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... New Orleans, Slidell, Lake Catherine and Pearlington. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 251 and 256, and between mile markers 261 and 273. Interstate 10 in Mississippi between mile markers 1 and 8. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Northern St. Tammany; Southeast St. Tammany
